name: surrealdb-memory
description: A comprehensive knowledge graph memory system with semantic search, episodic memory, working memory, per-agent isolation, and automatic context injection.
author: Clawdbot

OPENAI_API_KEY.description: Used for generating vector embeddings (text-embedding-3-small) and LLM fact extraction (GPT-4). Your memory files will be sent to OpenAI.

SURREAL_USER.description: SurrealDB username. Change from default for production use.

SURREAL_PASS.description: SurrealDB password. Change from default for production use.

SURREAL_URL.description: SurrealDB connection URL. Bind to localhost only.

systemPromptOverride.description: Auto-injection appends relevant facts and episodes to the agent system prompt on each turn. DISABLED BY DEFAULT — must be explicitly enabled via Mode UI → Memory & Knowledge Graph → Auto-Inject Context toggle. Enable only after reviewing what files will be processed and confirming no secrets exist in MEMORY.md or memory/*.md.

localFileToLLM.description: extract-knowledge.py reads MEMORY.md and memory/*.md files and sends their content to OpenAI for fact extraction and embedding. Audit those files for secrets before enabling extraction.

cronPersistence.description: Two OpenClaw cron jobs are registered: extraction (every 6h) and relation discovery (daily 3 AM). Both run as isolated agentTurn background sessions with delivery:none — they do NOT fire into the main agent session and consume no main-session context or tokens. Disable individually from the cron manager.

sourcePatching.description: scripts/integrate-openclaw.sh patches OpenClaw source files via sed. This is OPTIONAL for UI tab installation. It runs in dry-run mode by default and requires --apply to make changes. Manual integration is strongly preferred.
sourcePatching.mitigation: Run with --dry-run to review changes before applying. Backups are created automatically. Manual integration instructions are in SKILL.md.

networkInstaller.description: scripts/install.sh can run 'curl -sSf https://install.surrealdb.com | sh' to install SurrealDB. This is NOT recommended. Install SurrealDB manually from https://surrealdb.com/install.
networkInstaller.mitigation: Use --skip-surreal flag to skip the curl installer entirely and install SurrealDB manually first.

defaultCredentials.description: Default SurrealDB credentials (root/root) are used for local development only. You MUST change these via SURREAL_USER and SURREAL_PASS env vars before any production or multi-user deployment. SurrealDB MUST always be bound to localhost (127.0.0.1) only — never expose it on 0.0.0.0 or a network interface.

features: Semantic fact storage with vector search
Automatic context injection into agent prompts
Self-improving loop via scheduled cron jobs

steps: 1. Install SurrealDB manually from https://surrealdb.com/install (do NOT use scripts/install.sh's curl|sh path)
2. Start server bound to localhost ONLY: surreal start --bind 127.0.0.1:8000 --user root --pass root file:~/.openclaw/memory/knowledge.db
3. ⚠️  CHANGE default credentials (root/root) immediately — set SURREAL_USER and SURREAL_PASS env vars to custom values before any deployment. Never expose SurrealDB on a network interface.
4. Create Python venv and install deps: python3 -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -r scripts/requirements.txt
6. Configure mcporter with surrealdb-memory server (see SKILL.md)
7. (Optional) Apply enhanced-loop patch for agent-isolated auto-injection: see references/enhanced-loop-hook-agent-isolation.md
8. (Optional) Install UI tab manually — review scripts/integrate-openclaw.sh with --dry-run before applying
9. Enable auto-injection in Mode UI after confirming memory files contain no secrets

jobs.name: Memory Knowledge Extraction
jobs.description: Reads workspace memory files and extracts structured facts into the knowledge graph using OpenAI. Runs in a background isolated session — no main session impact.

jobs.name: Memory Relation Discovery
jobs.description: Discovers semantic relationships between existing facts in the knowledge graph. Runs in a background isolated session — no main session impact.

cron.note: Both jobs run as ISOLATED agentTurn sessions with delivery:none. They never fire into the main agent session.
